news_insight_text_link.news_insight_description: Deeptech startup alcemy, headquartered in Berlin, has raised €9.2 million to scale its cement decarbonization solution. Additionally, the company secured $10 million in funding led by Norrsken VC for its AI-powered sustainable cement production.

overview_description.description: Alcemy is a cement and concrete decarbonization startup developing predictive analysis software to assist cement and concrete manufacturers. Its software offers quality predictions for mixtures and their ingredients before shipping out products to counterbalance limestone and cement fluctuations.

about_short_description.short_description: Alcemy is a cement and concrete decarbonization startup developing predictive analysis software to assist cement and concrete manufacturers.

product.name: alcemy für Beton
product.description: A software for real-time monitoring and quality control of ready-mix concrete using machine learning to predict quality parameters.

product.name: alcemy für Zement
product.description: A software for continuous analysis and prediction of quality parameters in cement production, enabling optimization and CO2 reduction.

product.name: Sustainable Concrete Leaders
product.description: A network of developers and construction companies focused on using sustainable concrete to reduce CO2 emissions and resource waste.
